75035.bestFor: Achievement-oriented families with high budgets who want top schools, new construction, and youth sports culture
75035.honestTake: High-income families chasing elite schools and new builds. Not diverse, not affordable, but executes on the suburban family dream flawlessly.

75034.bestFor: Affluent professionals who want luxury amenities (The Star, Legacy West) + strong schools
75034.honestTake: Frisco's prestige ZIP. Big money, big homes, walkable upscale retail. If you can afford it and want polish, this is the tier.

75013.bestFor: Established families who want calm, mature neighborhoods with excellent schools
75013.honestTake: Quiet confidence. Not flashy, just consistently good. Great for families who want stability over excitement.

75070.bestFor: Families who value outdoor lifestyle, scenic neighborhoods, and breathing room
75070.honestTake: Pretty and peaceful but commute-heavy. Works if your job is north or remote.

75072.bestFor: Upper-middle families who want scenic, resort-like suburbia (Stonebridge Ranch)
75072.honestTake: Beautiful but isolated. European-village vibes at Adriatica, but you'll drive everywhere.

75024.bestFor: Corporate professionals who want urban energy + suburban schools (Legacy West lifestyle)
75024.honestTake: The suburban-urban hybrid. High diversity, great dining, corporate-corridor convenience. Not cheap, but delivers on lifestyle.

75025.bestFor: Families who want safe, reliable, well-run suburbia without flash
75025.honestTake: Peak 'good suburb' energy. Clean, organized, predictable. Zero excitement, maximum reliability.

75093.bestFor: Affluent families who want established elegance, big trees, and premium schools
75093.honestTake: Old-money Plano. Large homes, wide streets, golf-course neighborhoods. If you want mature prestige, this is it.

75078.bestFor: Families who want BIG new homes, rising schools, and space
75078.honestTake: McMansion paradise. 85% new construction. Low diversity. Great for California transplants who want Texas-sized everything.

75009.bestFor: Families betting on growth who want space, new builds, and small-town charm
75009.honestTake: Frontier suburbia. Cow pastures next to master-planned communities. High upside, high commute.

76092.bestFor: High-net-worth families who want the best schools, safety, and prestige in DFW
76092.honestTake: Suburban royalty. Carroll ISD dynasty. If money is no object and schools are everything, this is the throne.

76034.bestFor: Affluent families who want Southlake quality with less intensity
76034.honestTake: Quieter, warmer version of Southlake. Long-term residents who value community over flash.

75007.bestFor: Budget-conscious families or young professionals who value diversity, dining, and central location over top-tier schools
75007.honestTake: Under-the-radar workhorse. Highest diversity index in dataset. Schools are mixed (research feeders carefully). Great value if you prioritize location and culture over prestige.

75010.bestFor: Young families who want Frisco-adjacent location at non-Frisco prices with Hebron HS feeder access
75010.honestTake: Sleeper hit. Second-highest diversity, strong Lewisville ISD feeders (Hebron). Castle Hills energy without Castle Hills pricing.

75019.bestFor: Families who want elite schools, safety, parks, and DFW Airport proximity
75019.honestTake: The suburban gold standard. Everything works. Premium price, but you get what you pay for.

75052.bestFor: Budget-conscious families who prioritize fun (Joe Pool Lake, Epic Waters) over schools/safety
75052.honestTake: Most affordable option. Schools are weakest in dataset. Safety is lowest. But for pure family entertainment per dollar, it's unmatched.

75080.bestFor: Urban-suburban hybrids who want walkability, diversity, DART access, and central location
75080.honestTake: Highest diversity in dataset (0.94). Mature, established, unpretentious. CityLine gives urban energy. Best value for diverse, central living.

75081.bestFor: Budget-conscious buyers who want Richardson location without premium pricing
75081.honestTake: Working-class Richardson. Authentic, diverse, affordable. Not pretty, but solid bones and great location.

75082.bestFor: Young professionals/families who want walkable lifestyle (CityLine) + diversity + affordability
75082.honestTake: Richardson's rising star. Urban-suburban sweet spot. Best option for people who want walkability without moving to Dallas.

75038.bestFor: Commuters who want maximum location convenience at minimum price
75038.honestTake: Everything is 15 minutes away. Schools are weak. But if commute is king, nothing beats this.

75039.bestFor: Young professionals who want urban walkability (Las Colinas) + Coppell ISD feeders
75039.honestTake: Las Colinas core. Walk to work, walk to dinner. Coppell ISD access is the secret weapon. Best urban-suburban hybrid for the price.

75062.bestFor: Families who want Irving location with more residential feel than 75038/75039
75062.honestTake: Quieter Irving. Parks, trails, family-friendly streets. Schools improving. Solid middle-ground option.

75234.bestFor: Families who want walkability, DART access, and inner-ring convenience
75234.honestTake: Walkable, diverse, affordable. DART to Dallas. Historic downtown charm. Great for people who want urban access without urban prices.

75244.bestFor: Professionals who want Addison-adjacent location + larger homes
75244.honestTake: Upscale Farmers Branch. Bigger homes, better schools, close to Vitruvian Park. Smart move for Addison commuters.

75067.bestFor: Budget-conscious families who want lake access and community feel
75067.honestTake: Lake Lewisville lifestyle. Old Town charm. Schools are mixed. Best for outdoorsy families who don't obsess over school rankings.
